abstract: The bank cut the chief executive’s cash bonus and paid its top executives largely in stock awards tied to the company’s performance.
snippet: The bank cut the chief executive’s cash bonus and paid its top executives largely in stock awards tied to the company’s performance.
lead_paragraph: JPMorgan Chase paid Jamie Dimon, its chairman and chief executive, 35 percent more in 2015 than the previous year’s compensation package, which was only narrowly approved by shareholders.

headline.main: Jamie Dimon’s Compensation at JPMorgan Chase Rises 35%, to $27 Million
headline.print_headline: JPMorgan’s C.E.O. Got a 35% Raise in 2015, to $27 Million
